actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase the amount that a recipient may earn before being subject to a reduction in benefits on account of work.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to increase to $7,000 for each of taxable years 1981 and 1982 the amount which a beneficiary aged 65 or over may earn without a reduction in benefits. Provides that the amount which a beneficiary under the age of 65 may earn without a reduction in benefits shall be $5,200 for each of taxable years 1981 and 1982.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase the amount that a recipient may earn before being subject to a reduction in benefits on account of work.
